When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they should not view the ten powers of the Buddha as permanent or impermanent, nor should they view the four forms of fearlessness, the four unobstructed understandings, or the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha as permanent or impermanent;

they should not view the ten powers of the Buddha as pure or impure, nor should they view the four forms of fearlessness, the four unobstructed understandings, or the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha as pure or impure;

they are able to cultivate the emptiness liberation gate, and also able to cultivate the signless and wishless liberation gates;

they are able to cultivate the ground of joy, and also able to cultivate the ground of stainlessness, the luminous ground, the radiant ground, the ground of difficult to conquer, the ground of presence, the ground of far-reaching, the immovable ground, the ground of excellent wisdom, and the cloud of Dharma ground;
they are able to cultivate the five eyes, and also able to cultivate the six supernormal knowledges;

they are able to cultivate the ten powers of the Buddha, and also able to cultivate the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha;
they are able to cultivate the power of non-forgetfulness, and also able to cultivate the nature of constant relinquishment;
they are able to cultivate omniscience, and also able to cultivate the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects.
SubhÅ«ti!

At this time, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not see the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, does not see the name of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, does not see prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, does not see the name of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, and only diligently seeks omniscience.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva practices prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, and well understands the true characteristics of all dharmas, because he knows that there is neither defilement nor purity within them.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should truly understand the provisional designation of names and the provisional designation of dharmas.
SubhÅ«ti!

These bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, having truly understood the provisional designations of names and dharmas, do not become attached to form, do not become attached to feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness;
do not become attached to the eye faculty, do not become attached to the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind faculties;
do not become attached to the form realm, do not become attached to the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas realms;
do not become attached to the eye element, do not become attached to the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind elements;

do not become attached to the form element, do not become attached to the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma elements;ğŸ”½do not become attached to the eye consciousness element, do not become attached to the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness elements;
do not become attached to eye contact, do not become attached to ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact;

They do not cling to the feelings that arise from eye contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant, and they do not cling to the feelings that arise from ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant.
They do not cling to the earth element, and they do not cling to the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements.
They do not cling to causes, and they do not cling to conditions as antecedent, object, or predominance, or to the dharmas produced from conditions.

They do not cling to ignorance, and they do not cling to volitional activity, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and mental anguish.ğŸ”½They do not cling to the conditioned realm, and they do not cling to the unconditioned realm.
They do not cling to the contaminated realm, and they do not cling to the uncontaminated realm.
They do not become attached to the perfection of giving, nor to the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, wisdom, skillful means, vows, power, or knowledge;

They do not become attached to inner emptiness, nor to outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of general characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature of intrinsic nature, or emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities;

They do not become attached to suchness, nor to the realm of phenomena, the nature of phenomena, the unmistaken nature, the immutable nature, the inherent nature, the nature of non-arising, the determination of phenomena, the stability of phenomena, the limit of reality, the realm of space, or the inconceivable realm;

Do not cling to the four establishments of mindfulness, do not cling to the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, or eightfold noble path;
Do not cling to the noble truth of suffering, do not cling to the noble truths of the arising, cessation, or path [of suffering];
Do not cling to the four concentrations, do not cling to the four immeasurable [minds] or four formless concentrations;
Do not cling to the eight liberations, do not cling to the eight spheres of mastery, nine successive concentrations, or ten universal bases;
Do not cling to the door of liberation by emptiness, do not cling to the door of liberation by signlessness or wishlessness;
Do not cling to the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, do not cling to the samÄdhi gateways;

Do not cling to the ground of joy, do not cling to the ground of stainlessness, the luminous ground, the radiant ground, the ground of difficult to conquer, the ground of presence, the ground of far-reaching, the immovable ground, the ground of excellent wisdom, or the cloud of Dharma ground;
Do not cling to the five eyes, do not cling to the six supernormal knowledges;
They do not cling to the ten powers of the Buddha, nor do they cling to the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, or eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha;
They do not cling to great kindness, nor do they cling to great compassion, great joy, or great equanimity;
They do not cling to the thirty-two marks of a great person, nor do they cling to the eighty minor marks;
They do not cling to the unforgetting mind, nor do they cling to the nature of constant relinquishment;
They do not cling to omniscience, nor do they cling to the cognition of the path or the cognition of all aspects;
They do not cling to the fruit of entering the stream, nor do they cling to the fruits of the once-returner, non-returner, or arhat, or to individual enlightenment;
They do not cling to the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, nor do they cling to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the buddhas;
They do not cling to self, nor do they cling to sentient beings, living beings, born beings, nourished beings, persons, individuals, minds, youths, agents, experiencers, knowers, or seers;
They are not attached to ordinary beings, not attached to sages, not attached to bodhisattvas, not attached to tathÄgatas;
They are not attached to names, not attached to characteristics;
They are not attached to the adornment and purification of the Buddha land, not attached to the maturation of sentient beings, not attached to skillful means.
Why is it so?
Because all dharmas are non-existent, and the one who is attached, the one who is attached to, the place of attachment, and the time of attachment cannot be obtained.
Thus, SubhÅ«ti!

they can increase their giving, morality, patience, diligence,
concentration, wisdom, skillful means, vows, power, and knowledge pÄramitÄs,
and they can also abide in internal emptiness, external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great
emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, and limitlessğŸ”½emptiness.
emptiness, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of non-differentiation, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of self-characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics,
emptiness of all dharmas, emptiness of non-attainment, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-existence,
and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence of intrinsic nature, they are also able to abide in suchness, the dharma realm, the nature of dharmas,
the nature of non-falseness, the nature of non-differentiation, the nature of equality, the nature of detachment from birth, the determination of dharmas,
the abiding of dharmas, the ultimate reality, the space element, and the inconceivable element, they are also able to increase the four
applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four immeasurable [minds], and the four formless concentrations, they are also able to increase the
eight liberations, the eight spheres of mastery, the nine successive concentrations, and the ten universal bases, they are also able to increase
the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, they are also able to enter the correct nature of detachment from birth of bodhisattvas,
they are also able to abide in the irreversible stage of bodhisattvas, they are also able to perfect all dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s and
the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and samÄdhi gateways, can also perfect the ground of extreme joy, the ground of being free from defilements
, the ground of shining, the ground of blazing wisdom, the ground of being extremely difficult to conquer, the ground of direct presence, the ground of proceeding far,
the ground of immovability, the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of the cloud of Dharma, can also perfect the five eyes
, the six supernormal knowledges, can also perfect the ten powers of a buddha, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unhindered understanding,
and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha, can also perfect great kindness, great compassion,

great joy, and great equanimity, can also perfect the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks of excellence, can also perfect the quality of nonforgetfulness and the nature of constant relinquishment, can also perfect
omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects, and can also attain the supreme spiritual powers of a bodhisattva.

Having attained spiritual powers, they go from one buddha land to another, in order to bring sentient beings to maturity, in order to purify their own buddha lands, in order to see the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and having seen him, to make offerings, revere, honor, praise, and cause their roots of goodness to grow;
having caused them to grow well, they are able to hear and accept the true Dharma of the buddhas as they wish;

having heard and accepted it, up to sitting on the site of enlightenment, they are able to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and not lose it, and are able to attain mastery over all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and samÄdhi gateways.
Thus it is, SubhÅ«ti!
